---
name: coze-image-gen
description: Generate high-quality images (2K/4K) via coze-coding-dev-sdk. Returns image URLs directly without downloading.
homepage: https://www.coze.com
metadata: { "openclaw": { "emoji": "ğŸ¨", "requires": { "bins": ["npx"] } } }
---

# Coze Image Generation

Generate high-quality images from text prompts using coze-coding-dev-sdk. Returns image URLs directly.

## Quick Start

### Single Image

```bash
npx ts-node {baseDir}/scripts/gen.ts --prompt "A futuristic city at sunset"
```

### Batch Generation (Random Prompts)

```bash
npx ts-node {baseDir}/scripts/gen.ts --count 4
```

### With Custom Size

```bash
npx ts-node {baseDir}/scripts/gen.ts \
  --prompt "A serene mountain landscape" \
  --size 4K
```

### Sequential Image Generation (Story Mode)

```bash
npx ts-node {baseDir}/scripts/gen.ts \
  --prompt "A hero's journey through magical lands" \
  --sequential \
  --max-sequential 5
```

## Script Options

| Option                 | Description                               |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------- |
| `--prompt <text>`      | Image prompt (random if omitted)          |
| `--count <n>`          | Number of images (default: 1)             |
| `--size <size>`        | 2K, 4K, or WIDTHxHEIGHT (default: 2K)     |
| `--sequential`         | Enable sequential generation (story mode) |
| `--max-sequential <n>` | Max images for sequential (default: 5)    |

## Output

The script outputs image URLs directly to stdout:

```
[1/1] A futuristic city at sunset
  https://example.com/generated-image.png
```

## Text in Images

Wrap text in quotes for accurate rendering:

```bash
npx ts-node {baseDir}/scripts/gen.ts \
  --prompt 'A poster with the text "Hello World" on it'
```

## Notes

- Size range for custom dimensions: 2560x1440 to 4096x4096
- Image URLs have valid expiration - use directly when possible

arguments.content: # VIPSLEEP Website - Deployment Instructions ## ğŸš€ Quick Deployment Options ### Option 1: Netlify Drop (Easiest - No Account Required) 1. Go to: https://app.netlify.com/drop 2. Drag and drop this folder containing `vipsleep-website.html` onto the page 3. Wait 30 seconds - you'll get a live URL instantly! 4. Example URL: `https://your-site-name.netlify.app` ### Option 2: GitHub Pages (Free & Professional) 1. Create a GitHub account at: https://github.com/signup 2. Create a new repository (name it anything) 3. Upload `vipsleep-website.html` to the repository 4. Go to Settings â†’ Pages 5. Select `main` branch and save 6. Your site will be live at: `https://yourusername.github.io/repository-name` ### Option 3: Vercel (Best Performance) 1. Go to: https://vercel.com/signup 2. Download and install Vercel CLI: `npm i -g vercel` 3. Run: `vercel` in this directory 4. Follow the prompts 5. Your site will be deployed instantly! ### Option 4: Tiiny.host (Super Simple) 1. Go to: https://tiiny.host/ 2. Upload your HTML file 3. Get a free URL valid for 7 days 4. Perfect for quick previews ### Option 5: Surge.sh (Command Line) 1. Install surge: `npm install -g surge` 2. Run: `surge` in this directory 3. Follow the prompts to login and deploy 4. Your site will be live in seconds! ## ğŸ“ Current File Your website is ready at: `vipsleep-website.html` ## ğŸ¨ Customization Want to change something? - Colors: Look for `#1a365d` (navy blue) and `#fbbf24` (gold) - Text: Edit the content between HTML tags - Images: Replace the URL in the `` tag ## ğŸ’¡ Recommended Option For the fastest deployment with no account required, use **Option 1 (Netlify Drop)** - just drag and drop!
